channel.title: Ramah: Archived Good News
channel.description: Archived positive news stories from the Ramah collection

item.title: Is it worth getting a desk treadmill to boost your steps?
item.description: Recent surveys estimate more than 6.7 million Australians — almost half of all workers, and the majority in Sydney, Melbourne and Canberra — work from home at least some of the time in paid or unpaid roles.

item.title: Claire's and The Original Factory Shop enter administration
item.description: High street retailers Claire's and The Original Factory Shop are being put in to administration, risking 2,500 jobs.

item.title: Is Tasmania's 'red tide' a brilliant light show or an environmental problem?
item.description: During the night, it's a sparkling blue bioluminescence, attracting curious onlookers.

item.title: How much do you know about the meat pie? Test yourself (or treat yourself)
item.description: When Dr Karl wants to understand something, he doesn't mess around.

item.title: Woman swept away with her daughter was a beautiful soul, says friend
item.description: A close friend has paid tribute to a mother and daughter who were swept away at a seaside resort.

item.title: Scotland to have national bank holiday after first World Cup fixture
item.description: Football fans needn’t worry about the hangover when they celebrate, or otherwise, into the wee hours after Scotland’s first match in the 2026 World Cup – because the day after the 2am UK time fixture looks likely to be a national bank holiday there.

item.title: 'I am innocent': Deposed Venezuelan leader Maduro, wife enter pleas in NYC
item.description: Ousted Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and his wife Cilia Flores have pleaded not guilty to multiple charges, including narco-terrorism, in their first court appearance since being captured by US forces.

item.title: Wash well – and don’t forget the lid: how to clean your reusable water bottle
item.description: Environmentally friendly and convenient, reusable water bottles are on the rise.

item.title: Did you solve it? Are you as smart as Spock?
item.description: Earlier today I set the following puzzle, a pre-commemoration of World Logic Day on January 14.

item.description: That doesn’t help.

item.title: Providers dropping common anesthesia drug that’s also a climate super pollutant
item.description: The European Union now prohibits desflurane’s use during most procedures.

item.title: ‘See no evil, hear no evil’ Starmer goes on full sycophant alert | John Crace
item.description: Let’s face it.

item.title: The perfect way to switch off from work: the secret to a daily de-stress routine
item.description: Marilyn Monroe once said: “A career is wonderful, but you can’t curl up with it on a cold night.” Only these days, you can.

item.title: US oil companies see shares rise amid hopes that Venezuelan reserves can be tapped
item.description: Shares in US energy companies have jumped as investors bet that the US capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro will open opportunities to tap the country's oil reserves.

item.description: Around January in these parts we run a test on the dictionaries’ words of the year.

item.title: Australia ignoring spin forgets that good bowlers are good bowlers | Geoff Lemon
item.description: Why is a middling back-up seamer suddenly better than a quality spinner, whatever the conditions?.

item.title: The perfect way to do nothing: how to embrace the art of idling
item.description: On a rainy afternoon last weekend, plans got cancelled and I found myself at a loose end.

item.title: Prominent Labor figures join calls for antisemitism royal commission
item.description: A group of former Labor MPs, senators and party officials have signed an open letter calling for a national royal commission into the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: Scotland to get public holiday to celebrate World Cup return
item.description: Scots are to get a public holiday to mark the men's national team playing in its first World Cup since 1998.

item.title: Why a power plant is strategically important in the talks between Russia and Ukraine
item.description: NPR's A Martinez talks to Henry Sokolski of the Nonproliferation Policy Education Center about the Zaporizhzhia power plant and its importance in the peace talks between Russia and Ukraine.

item.title: Root hits masterful century for England before Head leads Australia fightback
item.description: The Richies were out in force for the final time on the second day at the Sydney Cricket Ground, an entire block decked out in either cream, bone, white, off-white, ivory, or beige.

item.title: Can you solve it? Are you as smart as Spock?
item.description: Which it does: World Logic Day is a Unesco-approved date in the academic calendar for the promotion of the study of deductive reasoning.

item.title: Sound of 2026: Reluctant rockers Royel Otis tipped for success
item.description: Aussie guitar duo Royel Otis show up to our interview looking artfully crumpled, beers in hand - but all is not quite what it seems.

item.title: Second Root century secures him as 'best player outside of Bradman'
item.description: Former Australian batter Darren Lehmann has hailed England batter Joe Root as "the best player outside of Bradman" following his second Ashes century of the series on day two of the Sydney Test.

item.title: Thanasi Kokkinakis and Nick Kyrgios make emotional doubles comeback with win in Brisbane
item.description: Thanasi Kokkinakis’s tears after a doubles match told the story as the injury-plagued Australian won in his latest and most dramatic return to the sport alongside old friend Nick Kyrgios.

item.title: Live: Joe Root finally falls after brilliant ton as England all out for 384
item.description: Joe Root eventually falls for 160, his biggest score on Australian soil and second century of the Ashes tour, as England is bowled out for 384 on day two.

item.title: Alford’s red-zone pick saves Falcons’ 19-17 win over Saints, giving NFC South title to Panthers
item.description: ATLANTA (AP) — Dee Alford’s red-zone interception stopped a potential go-ahead drive by New Orleans, and the Atlanta Falcons beat the Saints 19-17 on Sunday to give the NFC South title to the Carolina Panthers.

item.description: Dee Alford’s red-zone interception stopped a potential go-ahead drive by New Orleans, and the Atlanta Falcons beat the Saints 19-17 on Sunday to give the NFC South title to the Carolina Panthers.
